The Elder Sabbakāmin’s Birth Story
Like a burning kanikāra flower,🔽like a bright oil lamp,
shining like a medicinal herb,
like lightning in the sky.
Fearless, unruffled,🔽like a lion, king of beasts,
radiating the light of knowledge,
roaring at the assemblies of sectarians.
Lifting up this world,
cutting through all doubts,
roaring like a king of beasts,
I saw the Leader of the World.
I wore matted hair and bark cloth,
I was austere, upright, and radiant;
Taking a piece of antelope skin,
I offered it at his feet.
Taking the Kāḷānusāriya,
I anointed the Realised One;
Having anointed the Fully Awakened One,
I delighted the Leader of the World.
‘You lift up this world,
Great Sage who has crossed the flood,
You shine with the light of knowledge,
your supreme knowledge is not in vain.
You turn the wheel of Dhamma,🔽you roar at the sectarians,
the bull who has won the battle,
makes the earth tremble.
The waves in the great ocean,
In the sky, the clouds burst open;
So too, in your knowledge,
All views burst open.
As a fine-meshed net,
Is spread over a lake;
The creatures in the water,
Are oppressed for a while.
So too, in the world, the sectarians,
Dependent on various doctrines;
In your excellent knowledge,
They turn around, O Lord.
You are the support for those swept away by the flood,
You are the protector for those without a protector;
You are the refuge for those terrified by fear,
You are the final goal for those seeking a refuge.
You are the sole hero, without equal,
A mass of loving-kindness and compassion;
You are incomparable, well-balanced, peaceful,
Self-controlled, such, with conquered pride.
You are wise, free from delusion,
Not agitated, not a chatterer;
You are content, free from greed,
Pure, restrained, and stainless.
You have gone beyond the battlefield, conquered pride,
You are a triple-knowledge bearer, gone beyond the three worlds;
You have gone beyond the boundaries, respect the Dhamma,
Your purpose fulfilled, you have arisen for the benefit of the world.
You are a star, like a boat,
A source of comfort and support;
Fearless like a lion,
Magnificent like a king of elephants.’
Having praised with ten verses,
Padumuttara, the one of great fame;
Having worshipped the Teacher’s feet,
I stood there silently at that time.
Padumuttara, the one who knows the world,
the one who receives the offerings,
the Teacher, standing in the midst of the Community of monks,
spoke these verses:

analyzed: yaḥ me sīlam ca ñāṇam ca
translated: ‘He who praises my virtue, my knowledge,
and my good Dhamma,
I will proclaim him,
listen to me as I speak.
For sixty-thousand aeons,
he will delight in the world of the gods;
Having surpassed the other gods,
he will exercise sovereignty.
Later, having gone forth,
urged on by the root of merit,
in the dispensation of the Fortunate One Gotama,
he will go forth.
Having gone forth, with his body
having avoided bad deeds,
having fully understood all the pollutants,
he will be extinguished without pollutants.’

analyzed: yathā api meghaḥ thanaya  tat peti medinim
translated: Just as a cloud rains down
on this earth, so you, great hero,
have satisfied me with Dhamma.
Having praised virtue, knowledge, and Dhamma,
the Leader of the World,
I have attained the supreme peace,
the state of Nibbāna, the deathless.
Ah, surely that Fortunate One,
may the One with Eyes remain for a long time;
and may they know what is unknown,
and may they touch the Deathless State.
This is my last birth,
all the (lower) existences have been destroyed;
having fully understood all the pollutants,
I live without pollutants.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
I worshipped the Buddha;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of that praise.
My defilements have been burnt up,
all the (lower) existences have been destroyed;
all the pollutants have been destroyed,
there is no continuation in existence.
It is good for me,
… and so on …
the Teacher’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical knowledges,
… and so on …
the Teacher’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Sabbakāmī recited these verses.
